results.title: Adventures in the Strait
results.creator_credit: Sorogo Mills, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The rope that linked the dinghy to the boat had snapped. It was up to me to fix it. Sorogo’s story about an experience that showed him what he was really made of.

results.title: Noise destroys
results.creator_credit: Mike Woolveridge, Phillip Mark-Law, John Honey, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1979 film deals with the effects of industrial noise on hearing. Presented as a dramatic short film, the narrative follows the protagonist, Len, as he discovers he is partially deaf due to twenty years of working with loud machines in a factory and goes on a crusade to improve working conditions. The film is directed at employers as well as employees, showing the importance of wearing safety gear and machines being modified or insulated to limit sound production. The film contains light-hearted moments of comedy, as Len goes about convincing his colleagues and management of the significance of the issue.

Produced by the Tasmanian Film Corporation for the Department of Labour and Industry.

The colour is faded throughout the film.

Cast: Max Cullen, Brian Duhig, Barry Pierce, John Hale, Keith Jarvis, Barrie Muir, Jack Perry, Richard Meredith, Billie Hammerberg, Tony Boden, Kevin Lacey, Don Glover, Tracy Lee, Bob Gunning, Peter Lewis, Matthew Rhodes

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Bill Justice and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An updated version of the story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is inventive in its use of three-dimensional animation techniques that would be of special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Ross Dimsey and Naked Country Productions
results.brief_description: Kangaroo is D. H. Lawrence’s story of love, violence and political intrigue based on his personal experiences in Australia in 1922. In search of a freer, more tolerant world than Europe, in which to rebuild their marriage, famous writer Richard Somers and his wife Harriet come to Australia, where they meet Kangaroo, the charismatic leader of a secret fascist army, who attempts to seduce Somers into his ideas. When Somers refuses his friendship Richard and Harriet are threatened by the same crude, political thuggery which they believed they had left behind in Europe. Stars Colin Friels and Judy Davis who was awarded the Best Actress AFI Award for this role. Photography is by Dan Burstall.

results.title: Kampuchea: the long road back
results.creator_credit: Leonard Teale, John Wall and Canterbury Productions
results.brief_description: Commissioned by the sponsors of the Kampuchean Relief Appeal this made for television documentary shows how donations to International Relief Aid were used to bring aid to Kampuchea. Also records the plight of Kampucheans still struggling for survival after the death and destruction caused by the Pol Pot regime. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.title: Kamikaze taxi (D)
results.creator_credit: Masato Harada, Sasumu Tanaka and Pony Canyon
results.brief_description: ‘Kamikaze Taxi’ is a Japanese Yakusa film with a social conscience. Tatsuo has a promising future in the Yakusa but when his girl-friend is killed after a prostitute she arranged for a high ranking politician is brutally attacked, Tatsuo (Kazuya Takahashi) jeopardises everything to seek revenge. He steals $2 million from the politician and soon the Yakusa and the politician’s henchmen are after his blood. When he hires a taxi to escape, Kantake (Koji Yakusho), a Japanese-Peruvian immigrant, becomes his accomplice as they battle to outwit their pursuers. Writer/director Masato Harada has created an explosive and exciting film which comments on the Japanese traditions of honourable suicide typified by the World War 2 kamikaze pilots, as well as the current state of Japanese society and politics. The film is set in 1994 when Japan was thrown into chaos after Prime Minister Husokawa resigned after corruption scandals. Koji Yakusho is magnetic as the quiet but powerful Kantake and Kazuya Takahashi successfully embodies the restlessness of the youth of Japan. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Veronica
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Nine-year-old Veronica Makarewicz leads a double life. Born of Polish parents, she dances Polish dances, goes twice weekly to a Polish school, and talks to Polish customers in her parents’ bakery. But this film shows that she is also very Canadian.

results.title: Kama sutra
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Lydia Dean Pilcher, Pandora Films, Pony Canyon, NDF International and Mirabai Films
results.brief_description: Centred on the text The Kama Sutra this is a film about class and politics in sixteenth century India - a lush melodrama, featuring explicit sexual posturing. Initially it is the story of two women: Maya, a rebellious servant girl and Tara her mistress and future queen, childhood friends who become adult rivals. Publicly humiliated during Tara’s nuptial celebrations, a vengeful Maya seduces the king prior to his wedding night. Consequently Maya is spurned and turned out into the street, despite the king’s burgeoning obsession for her. Maya has an affair with a sculptor of erotic deities, before training as a courtesan, returning to the palace as a professional seductress. Meanwhile the king has fallen into an opium addled, hedonistic stupor that threatens the future of the kingdom. Mira Nair’s (Mississippi Masala, Salaam Bombay!, Monsoon Wedding) film operates as a critique of the class system and is a tract about self-determination and sexual politics, but it is overwhelmed by a simplistic script and predictable character developments. Nair may have been reaching for a feminist interpretation of the classic erotic text, as well as a narrative about spiritual awakening, but the key joys here are the rich colourful palette and exotic setting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mira Nair, Lydia Dean Pilcher, Pandora Films, Pony Canyon, NDF International and Mirabai Films

results.title: Kevin Alec
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children of Canada”.
In the mountainous country near Lillooet, British Columbia, eleven-year-old Kevin Alec of the Fountain Indian Reserve learns to make fishnets with his grandfather, and skin and tan hides with his aunt. He goes fishing with his grandmother and horseback riding with his brother. Life is full of wonderful things to do and to learn. Will Kevin eventually abandon his Indian way of life or will it be a source of continuing enrichment?

results.title: I'll find a way
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children of Canada”.
When nine-year-old Nadia is allowed to attend a regular school, she knows the kids will tease her but she’ll “find a way to deal with it.” Nadia has spina bifida, a congenital condition that has caused a lack of sensation from the knees down. She uses crutches in order to walk. Nadia, in her own candid way, makes it clear that she is not looking for sympathy. She can do many things that children do, only she has a different way of doing them. (Ten Awards including Oscar, Hollywood; Salerno; Dubuque)
